A bag full of gems is obtainable from Prospector Percy's Nugget Shop for 40 golden nuggets, from Belona's Mining Guild Mineral Exchange for 20 unidentified minerals, or from Dusuri's Star Shop for 300 stardust. Each bag contains an assortment of 40 noted uncut gems.

The chances of an individual gem being an uncut onyx is 1/100,000,000, making the chance per bag approximately 1/2,500,000. In terms of probability, this makes it the rarest drop in the game.[1]

The bags are exclusive to the stores they are bought from and therefore cannot be sold to another store in exchange for a different currency.

Contents

  • 1 Percentages
  • 2 Shop locations
  • 3 Changes
  • 4 Trivia
  • 5 References

Percentages[edit | edit source]

The probabilities in this section are an estimation based on the data of opening 1,916 bags full of gems, totalling 76,640 uncut gems being obtained.

Item Quantity Rarity Price High Alch
Uncut sapphire1 (noted)40 × 4,993/10,00036915
Uncut emerald1 (noted)40 × 3,468/10,00055730
Uncut ruby1 (noted)40 × 1,180/10,0001,20560
Uncut diamond1 (noted)40 × 309/10,0002,825120
Uncut dragonstone1 (noted)40 × 62/10,00014,493600
Uncut onyx1 (noted)40 × 1/100,000,0002,086,911120,000

According to these estimates (excluding an uncut onyx), a bag would be expected to be worth 27,470.8 on average, making a golden nugget worth 686.77, or a Stardust worth 91.57. The uncut onyx adds just 0.83 coins per bag due to its rarity.

Comparatively, the price of soft clay is currently 172, making each soft clay pack worth 17,200 and each golden nugget worth 1,720, or a Stardust worth 114.67.

On average, a player can expect 2,502.86 crafting experience per bag using the above ratios if they were to cut all the gems.

Shop locations[edit | edit source]

Attempting to sell a bag full of gems bought at the Motherlode Mine back to the Mining Guild (in order to indirectly swap nuggets for minerals) will not work.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
18 June 2020
(update | poll)

Bags full of gems are now available from the Mining Guild Mineral Exchange.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • The first player to obtain an uncut onyx from a bag full of gems was enneUni on 15 June 2020, more than four years after release.[2][3]

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Old School RuneScape. "Ballista Combat Sneak Peek - Old School RuneScape Q&A." (36:26), YouTube video. 21 April 2016.
  2. ^ Jagex. Old School RuneScape's Twitter account. 15 June 2020. (Archived from the original on 15 June 2020.) Old School RuneScape: "We can officially confirm that a player has received an uncut onyx from a gem bag. A 1/100,000,000 chance! Congratulations enneUni!!"
  3. ^ The Old School Team. "Poll 71 and Darkmeyer Updates". 18 June 2020. (Archived from the original.) Old School RuneScape News.

A '''bag full of gems''' is obtainable from [[Prospector Percy's Nugget Shop]] for 40 [[golden nugget]]s, from [[Belona]]'s [[Mining Guild Mineral Exchange]] for 20 [[unidentified minerals]], or from [[Dusuri's Star Shop]] for 300 [[stardust]]. Each bag contains an assortment of 40 noted [[uncut gem]]s.

The chances of an individual gem being an uncut onyx is 1/100,000,000, making the chance per bag approximately 1/2,500,000. In terms of probability, this makes it the rarest drop in the game.{{CiteVideo|author=Old School RuneScape|title=Ballista Combat Sneak Peek - Old School RuneScape Q&A|url=g-QYut-E2aU?t=2187|timestamp=36:26|date=21 April 2016|site=YouTube}}

The bags are exclusive to the stores they are bought from and therefore '''cannot''' be sold to another store in exchange for a different currency.

==Percentages==
''The probabilities in this section are an estimation based on the data of opening 1,916 bags full of gems, totalling 76,640 uncut gems being obtained.''
<!--36056 sapphire/25009 emerald/8539 ruby/2232 diamond/404 dstone-->
{{DropsTableHead}}
{{DropsLineReward|name=Uncut sapphire|quantity=1 (noted)|rolls=40|rarity=4993/10000}}
{{DropsLineReward|name=Uncut emerald|quantity=1 (noted)|rolls=40|rarity=3468/10000}}
{{DropsLineReward|name=Uncut ruby|quantity=1 (noted)|rolls=40|rarity=1180/10000}}
{{DropsLineReward|name=Uncut diamond|quantity=1 (noted)|rolls=40|rarity=309/10000}}
{{DropsLineReward|name=Uncut dragonstone|quantity=1 (noted)|rolls=40|rarity=62/10000}}
{{DropsLineReward|name=Uncut onyx|quantity=1 (noted)|rolls=40|rarity=1/100000000}}
{{DropsTableBottom}}

According to these estimates (excluding an uncut onyx), a bag would be expected to be worth {{Coins|{{GEP|Uncut sapphire}} * 19.96 + {{GEP|Uncut emerald}} * 13.85 + {{GEP|Uncut ruby}} * 4.73 + {{GEP|Uncut diamond}} * 1.24 + {{GEP|Uncut dragonstone}} * 0.22}} on average, making a golden nugget worth {{Coins|{{GEP|Uncut sapphire}} * 19.96 / 40 + {{GEP|Uncut emerald}} * 13.85 / 40 + {{GEP|Uncut ruby}} * 4.73 / 40 + {{GEP|Uncut diamond}} * 1.24 / 40 + {{GEP|Uncut dragonstone}} * 0.22 / 40}}, or a Stardust worth {{Coins|{{GEP|Uncut sapphire}} * 19.96 / 300 + {{GEP|Uncut emerald}} * 13.85 / 300 + {{GEP|Uncut ruby}} * 4.73 / 300 + {{GEP|Uncut diamond}} * 1.24 / 300 + {{GEP|Uncut dragonstone}} * 0.22 / 300}}. The [[uncut onyx]] adds just {{coins|{{GEP|Uncut onyx}} / 2500000}} coins per bag due to its rarity.

Comparatively, the price of [[soft clay]] is currently {{Coins|{{GEP|Soft clay}}}}, making each [[soft clay pack]] worth {{Coins|{{GEP|Soft clay|100}}}} and each golden nugget worth {{Coins|{{GEP|Soft clay|10}}}}, or a Stardust worth {{Coins|{{GEP|Soft clay|100}}/150}}.

On average, a player can expect 2,502.86 crafting experience per bag using the above ratios if they were to cut all the gems.

==Shop locations==
{{Store locations list|Bag full of gems}}Attempting to sell a bag full of gems bought at the Motherlode Mine back to the Mining Guild (in order to indirectly swap nuggets for minerals) will not work.
